Blog People

Hi, I'm Chris.

And this is my website. I call it hot dogs and eggs.

I spend my days supporting customers at Highrise. We're a small software company that helps people keep track of who they talk to, what they talk about, and when to follow up.

Here's a few things I believe:

  • The best answer is a question.
  • Listen to what people do, not just what they say.
  • Support your product like a customer, become a user.

And a few things I do day-to-day:

  • Communicate directly with customers
  • Share ways to improve the product
  • Write help documentation

I work remotely and reside in Charlotte, NC. And here's more about what you'll find here.

Side projects

Here are a couple side projects that I have fun with.

Transcribed Advice from real people

Many moons ago I was a sports information director. A fancy way of saying I helped cover the athletic teams at my alma mater, UNC. One of my tasks was to transcribe quotes to help reporters meet deadlines. I hated transcribing audio at the time, but somehow miss it today :)

Now I irregularly transcribe talks and interviews I find interesting across the web. It's a strange project, but I love it. Here's one of my favorite transcriptions.

Dale Carnegie is My Homeboy

If I could only recommend one book to you, it would be How to Win Friends and Influence People by Dale Carnegie. Millions have read it for a reason. The principles are timeless.

Reload the page to see all 30 principles from the book one at a time. The project is to remind all of us to be considerate.

Wait, what's with hot dogs and eggs?

I'm sure you're wondering about the name of this website. Most people claim their own name as a domain. My namesakes at Ernest and Julio Gallo Winery have commandeered domains that include the word "gallo" in them.

So when I started this site a few years ago, I was stumped on a domain name. And then I heard my grandma talking about making hot dogs and eggs for me as a kid. I kept saying it all day. Hot dogs and eggs. It made me smile.

I bought the domain name and laughed. But it stuck. It's goofy and different, just like me. A curious combination, hot dogs and eggs.
